greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of odd divisors of sigma(n).
comment: sigma(n) = sum of divisors of n, A000203.
link: Charles R Greathouse IV, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: a(8) = 4 because sigma(8) = 15 and the 4 odd divisors are { 1, 3, 5, 15}.
mathematica: f[n_] := Block[{d = Divisors[DivisorSigma[1,n]]}, Count[OddQ[d], True]]; Table[f[n], {n, 80}]
results.author: _Michel Lagneau_, Jul 23 2011
